METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Češko-slovaški vpliv na slovensko politiko in njen odnos do narodnega vprašanja po letu 1918
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Czechoslovakian Influences on Slovene Politics and the Latter’s Position on the National Question after 1918
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Kregar, Tone
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: Močan češki vpliv na slovensko družbo in politiko, ki smo mu priča zlasti v drugi polovici 19. stoletja, se je v precejšnji meri ohranil tudi po razpadu Avstro-Ogrske. Proti Pragi je bil po letu 1918 usmerjen zlasti liberalni del slovenske politike, saj sta povsem po čeških vzorih nastali narodno socialistična in kmetijska stranka. Zaradi primerljivih (med)nacionalnih razmer v češko-slovaški in jugoslovanski državi pa je določene vplive in paralele mogoče najti tudi v odnosu političnih strank do narodnega vprašanja tako na domačih kot tujih tleh.

The influence of Bohemia on Slovene politics and society, particularly strong in the second half of the 19th Century, did not cease after thè disintegration of Austria-Hungary. Slovene libérais in particular sought inspiration in Prague; this resulted in the formation of the National Socialist Party and the Independent Farmers’ Party, both modeled after Czech politicai parties. In view of comparable (inter)national circumstances in Czechoslovakia and in Yugoslavia certain influences and parallels can be found also in the position of their political parties on the national question, both at home and abroad.
